medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In April 1998, a 12-year-old boy experienced acute abdominal pain with fever after finishing a 10-day course of amoxicillin-clavulanate for a sinus infection. He underwent an appendectomy, and two days post-surgery, he began to experience diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously had a sinus infection treated with amoxicillin-clavulanate, and underwent appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father had treated calves with a severe diarrheal disorder shortly before the patient's illness.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had not accompanied his father on visits to other herds and had not traveled outside the United States in the two weeks prior to his illness.
